Notes: Central plains; typical Deccan regur (black cotton) soils.
Flat Deccan plains; extensive regur soils, agriculture dominant.
Hilly and plateau areas on eastern/western fringes; lateritic and shallow soils.
Parts lie along Bhima river floodplain giving alluvial pockets.
Haveli taluka includes urban plain; regur soils present in agricultural areas.
Indapur: plain agricultural region with regur soils and some alluvium.
Upland, rocky, and erosion-prone; mixed red and lateritic soils.
Mixed landscape; transitional soils between plains and uplands.
Maval is hilly/rocky (Western Deccan edge) with shallow, gravelly soils.
Mulshi foothills of Western Ghats; lateritic & red soils common.
Plains and agricultural tracts with regur dominating.
Shirur has river influence and plain tracts; mix of alluvial & black soils.
Velhe in Western Ghats, high lateritic influence; shallow soils.
